message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.NA, cs.AI. 

The paper discusses convergence rates of stochastic processes, which is a common topic in machine learning and optimization, suggesting cs.LG as the most likely sub-category. The use of non-Gaussian and state-dependent noise is also a common topic in information theory and control systems, suggesting cs.IT and cs.SY as likely sub-categories. The study of non-convex potential functions is relevant to numerical analysis and scientific computing, suggesting cs.NA as a possible sub-category. Finally, the application of the theoretical findings to Stochastic Gradient Descent (SGD) for training deep neural networks suggests cs.AI as a possible sub-category.
